title: Did Franz Kafka invent messages from a missing doll to comfort a little girl?
subtitle: "In the end, love will come back another way," the famous author of "transformation" was quoted as saying in viral social media bulletins.
author: Dan MacGuill
vclaim: In the early 1920s, Franz Kafka consoled a young girl he met in the park by writing dozens of letters to her, pretending to be her missing doll.
